body: Little is known of Kemper’s background or art training; however, he is known primarily for his landscapes typically depicting river valley settings. He had made at least one excursion to the Adirondack Mountains and Lake George areas, as this painting, titled “Lake George”, so wonderfully documents. He is also known to have painted the scenic Ohio River Valley.
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 19.5 x 29.5 inches/Signed lower left
metaTitle: George Hetzel Painting - Boys Camping Along Paint Creek - 19th Century American Fine Art
metaDescription: George Hetzel was born in the French province of Alsace, but immigrated with his family to America in 1828, settling in Allegheny City (Pittsburgh's North Side). I
title: Boys Camping along Paint Creek
